newsitem.title: USA: Conf Board warns of food, materials inflation.
newsitem.headline: Conf Board warns of food, materials inflation.

text.p: U.S. financial markets may be overly optimistic that inflation will remain at current low levels, the Conference Board said on Thursday.
Increased global demand for food, energy and raw materials has boosted prices of those items and probably will put growing pressures on consumer prices going forward, the Conference Board warned.
"Food and energy prices are currently rising faster than the core inflation rate--a red flag for future inflation," it said in a report.
Wage increases tend to follow, rather than lead, price changes, so the markets' focus on wage-related inflation could be myopic, the report said.
On the flip side, current low inflation is not likely to erode living standards, the Conference Board said.

"There is so much change and choice in the economy that, at reasonably low inflation rates, consumers can alter their spending patterns to take advantage of new products in ways that substantially protect ... their living standards," it said.
